017package org.microbean.invoke;
018
019import java.util.Objects;
020
021import java.util.function.Supplier;
022
023import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingEncouraged;
024
025/**
026 * A {@link Supplier} that may be <em>deterministic</em>.
027 *
028 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
029 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
030 *
031 * @see #deterministic()
032 */
033@FunctionalInterface
034public interface DeterministicSupplier<T> extends Supplier<T> {
035
036  /**
037   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link
038   * DeterministicSupplier} is <em>deterministic</em>.
039   *
040   * <p>A {@link DeterministicSupplier} is deterministic if and only
041   * if:</p>
042   *
043   * <ul>
044   *
045   * <li>Any two invocations of the {@link #get() get()} method, on
046   * any thread, return either the same object or objects that are
047   * indistinguishable from one another and that can be substituted
048   * for each other interchangeably, or</li>
049   *
050   * <li>Any two invocations of the {@link #get() get()} method, on
051   * any thread, throw {@link RuntimeException}s of exactly the same
052   * type</li>
053   *
054   * </ul>
055   *
056   * <p>The default implementation of this method returns {@code
057   * false}.</p>
058   *
059   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link
060   * DeterministicSupplier} is <em>deterministic</em>
061   *
062   * @idempotency This method and its overrides must be idempotent and
063   * deterministic.
064   *
065   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
066   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
067   *
068   * @see #get()
069   */
070  @OverridingEncouraged
071  public default boolean deterministic() {
072    return false;
073  }
074
075
076  /*
077   * Static methods.
078   */
079
080
081  /**
082   * Returns a new {@link DeterministicSupplier} whose {@link
083   * #deterministic()} method will return the supplied {@code
084   * deterministic} value and whose {@link #get()} method will return
085   * the result of invoking the {@link Supplier#get()} method on the
086   * supplied {@code supplier}.
087   *
088   * @param <T> the type of value the returned {@link
089   * DeterministicSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
090   *
091   * @param deterministic whether the supplied {@link Supplier} is
092   * deterministic
093   *
094   * @param supplier the {@link Supplier} whose {@link #get()} method
095   * will be called; must not be {@code null}
096   *
097   * @return a new {@link DeterministicSupplier} whose {@link
098   * #deterministic()} method will return the supplied {@code
099   * deterministic} value and whose {@link #get()} method will return
100   * the result of invoking the {@link Supplier#get()} method on the
101   * supplied {@code supplier}
102   *
103   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code null}
104   *
105   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
106   *
107   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent but is deterministic.
108   *
109   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
110   * threads.
111   */
112  public static <T> DeterministicSupplier<T> of(final boolean deterministic, final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
113    Objects.requireNonNull(supplier);
114    return new DeterministicSupplier<>() {
115      @Override // DeterministicSupplier<T>
116      public final boolean deterministic() {
117        return deterministic;
118      }
119      @Override // DeterministicSupplier<T>
120      public final T get() {
121        return supplier.get();
122      }
123    };
124  }
125
126  /**
127   * Returns a new {@link DeterministicSupplier} whose {@link
128   * #deterministic()} method will return {@code true} and whose
129   * {@link #get()} method will return the supplied {@code value}.
130   *
131   * @param <T> the type of value the returned {@link
132   * DeterministicSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
133   *
134   * @param value the value the new {@link DeterministicSupplier} will
135   * return from its {@link #get()} method; may be {@code null}
136   *
137   * @return a new {@link DeterministicSupplier} whose {@link
138   * #deterministic()} method will return {@code true} and whose
139   * {@link #get()} method will return the supplied {@code value}
140   *
141   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
142   *
143   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent but is deterministic.
144   *
145   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
146   * threads.
147   */
148  public static <T> DeterministicSupplier<T> of(final T value) {
149    return new DeterministicSupplier<>() {
150      @Override // DeterministicSupplier<T>
151      public final boolean deterministic() {
152        return true;
153      }
154      @Override // DeterministicSupplier<T>
155      public final T get() {
156        return value;
157      }
158    };
159  }
160
161}
